company.name: Upstream
company.tagline: Early-warning payer risk intelligence for specialty practices
company.positioning: Prevention-focused payer behavior monitoring before claims are submitted

valueProposition.primary: Know what's changing in payer behavior before it costs you
valueProposition.secondary: Specialty-specific intelligence for dialysis, ABA therapy, imaging, and home health
valueProposition.differentiator: Early-warning behavioral drift detection vs. reactive real-time alerts

coreDifferentiators: Early-warning payer behavioral drift detection (weeks before denials appear)
Specialty-specific rules for dialysis (ESRD PPS), ABA (authorization tracking), imaging (prior auth patterns), home health (OASIS tracking)
Transparent fixed monthly pricing - no percentage of recovery
Prevention-focused: alerts before submission, not after
DriftWatch™ proprietary algorithm for longitudinal payer behavior analysis

pricing.structure: Transparent tiered pricing based on practice size

tiers.name: Medium Practice
includes: Specialty-specific rules (dialysis, ABA, imaging, home health)

notes: No percentage-based fees - fixed cost regardless of denial volume

earlyWarningDetection.description: DriftWatch™ detects payer behavioral changes 2-4 weeks before denials appear
earlyWarningDetection.uniqueValue: Longitudinal analysis of payer patterns to predict future denials

behavioralDriftTracking.description: Tracks subtle shifts in payer approval patterns, authorization requirements, documentation standards
behavioralDriftTracking.uniqueValue: Proprietary algorithm analyzes trends over time, not just point-in-time alerts

specialtySpecificRules.description: Custom intelligence for dialysis (ESRD PPS changes), ABA (authorization tracking), imaging (prior auth), home health (OASIS)
supportedSpecialties: Dialysis (ESRD PPS bundle changes, modifier tracking, comorbidity shifts)
ABA Therapy (authorization expiration, session limits, medical necessity changes)
Imaging (prior authorization pattern shifts, medical necessity criteria)
Home Health (OASIS documentation changes, episode timing, LUPA risks)

realTimeAlerts.description: Alerts are early-warning (pre-submission), not real-time at submission
realTimeAlerts.note: By design - we alert before claims go out, not after

preSubmissionWarnings.description: Alerts before claims are submitted, allowing prevention rather than recovery

denialScopeAnalytics.description: DenialScope™ dashboard shows denial trends, root causes, and prevention opportunities

actionableRecommendations.description: Specific recommendations on how to adjust coding, documentation, or workflows to prevent denials

ehrSystems.description: EHR-independent - connects via data feeds, not embedded in EHR
ehrSystems.note: By design - allows faster implementation and flexibility

strengths: Early-warning behavioral drift detection (2-4 weeks before denials appear)
Specialty-specific intelligence for dialysis, ABA, imaging, home health
Transparent fixed monthly pricing (no percentage of recovery)
Quarterly business reviews for all customers (not just enterprise)
weaknesses: Not embedded in EHR workflows (separate login required)
Fewer integrations than established players (newer product)
No real-time alerts at point of claim submission (by design - we're pre-submission)
Narrower specialty focus (not ideal for general practices outside dialysis/ABA/imaging/home health)
Less market presence and brand recognition than established RCM vendors
targetSegments: Dialysis centers (5-50 stations) focused on ESRD PPS changes and comorbidity tracking
ABA therapy clinics (10-100 BCBAs) managing authorization expirations and session limits
Imaging centers (outpatient radiology, MRI, CT) tracking prior authorization pattern shifts
Home health agencies (small to mid-size) monitoring OASIS documentation and episode timing

activities: Initial kickoff call with onboarding specialist
Connect data feed from clearinghouse or set up CSV upload
Verify data quality and historical claims visibility
Configure specialty-specific rules (dialysis ESRD PPS, ABA auth tracking, etc.)
Set alert thresholds based on practice's denial tolerance
Train staff on DriftWatch and DenialScope dashboards
Test alert delivery (email, in-app, Slack integration if desired)
Review first batch of early-warning alerts
Quarterly business reviews to refine alert rules
Adjust specialty-specific configurations as payers change policies
